body_html:
Yeah, they probably should've removed his mod privileges from his alts instead of banning him. I'll try to ask captainmeta4 about this. By the way, the admins said he got banned for 7 days on his main account, while his alts were permabanned.

@captainmeta4, I'm wondering if there could be a different punishment for violating the 10 guilds rule in the future. Would it make sense/be viable to revoke the mod privileges of the alt accounts instead of permabanning them? (I'm guessing it would make sense to suspend/ban someone if they broke the rule repeatedly though.)

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

body:
I think perma-banning alts that have been used for rule circumvention is justified. Not sure about the main account. Temporary suspension sounds more reasonable to avoid "admin DDoS" sort of attacks.

Also there needs to be consideration to the fact that these rules weren't in place at the time the admin action was decided.
body_html:
I think perma-banning alts that have been used for rule circumvention is justified. Not sure about the main account. Temporary suspension sounds more reasonable to avoid "admin DDoS" sort of attacks.

Also there needs to be consideration to the fact that these rules weren't in place at the time the admin action was decided.
